invocation_test: bash tools/autoswarm.sh --dry-run — exited 0, logged correct claude invocation path
filesystem_watcher_example: inotifywait -m -e create workspace/autoswarm-trigger | while read; do bash tools/autoswarm.sh; done
trigger_file: workspace/autoswarm-trigger — written by Stop hook; consumed and re-written by autoswarm.sh each cycle
notes: Stop hook wired as second entry in settings.json Stop array (session-end-check.py runs first)
autoswarm.sh includes stale lockfile detection to handle crashes
Trigger file is both consumed (at start) and re-written (at end) to enable continuous chaining
F-CC4 (min budget floor) still open — $2 is a conservative placeholder pending empirical measurement
next_step: Run F-CC4: 5 sessions at $0.25/$0.50/$1.00/$2.00/$5.00 to find minimum viable budget; measure L+P output per dollar
